availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
State of Ohio.
Hamilton County.
City of Cincinnati. } ss.

Be it remembered that on this 20th day of January A. D. 1863. before me the subscriber a Notary Public in and for said County authorized by law to administer oaths personally came John P. Jackson who before me upon oath declares that he will well and truly execute and perform all and singular the duties appertaining to his office and station as Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky, within the State of Ohio, by virtue of a Commission therefor issued by his Excellency J. F. Robinson, Governor Commonwealth of Kentucky to said Jackson of date January. 14, 1863.
Sworn to before me and subscribed in my presence by J. P. Jackson this January. 20, 1863.

Herbert Jenney
Notary Public
Ham Co Ohio

J. P. Jackson --
Com'r Deeds in Ohio for Kentucky
Oath of Office
Ohio
Filed Jany 21, 1863
